an3.2:1.1: “A fool is characterized by their deeds; an astute person is characterized by their deeds. And wisdom is evident in its outcome.
an3.2:1.2: A fool is known by three things.
an3.2:1.4: Bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.
an3.2:1.5: These are the three things by which a fool is known.
an3.2:2.1: An astute person is known by three things.
an3.2:2.3: Good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.
an3.2:2.4: These are the three things by which an astute person is known.
an3.2:3.1: So you should train like this:
an3.2:3.2: ‘We will reject the three things by which a fool is known, and we will undertake and follow the three things by which an astute person is known.’
